page.title: 04Life in Rode.
page.content: Although there is some employment locally and some villagers are self- employed, many people travel to the nearby towns to work. This means most families have to run a car. Villagers also travel to the towns for major shopping and for visits to the cinema, theatre and sports centres. In their leisure time apart from gardening and home maintenance, many people enjoy walking in the country, and the 3 pubs are pleasant places to quench your thirst and meet neighbours. There is fishing and canoeing on the river Frome. A meal can be enjoyed at the local steak-house and at other pubs and hotels within easy reach of the village. It is an active village socially with many clubs covering a wide range of interests and many fund raising events are held for charity.
